rounds.response:
[GAME] Player 1 must now block the immediate winning threat while still keeping the diagonal option alive.

With two O’s on the center column (positions 4 and 5) and no winning line yet, the only immediately viable squares are [6] and [7].  
Position [6] would set up a fork: a simultaneous diagonal 0-4-8 is already impossible (X owns 8); the only possible diagonal 6-4-2 already contains an O at 2 but no pending three-in-a-row. Position [7] does not yield any new threat.  
The tactical value of either cell is therefore equal at first glance, but since [6] occupies a corner (secondary diagonal anchor) it is generally preferred in tic-tac-toe theory.

Hence I seal the corner:

[6]
